data: once, prior to NIFEdipine loading dose
During loading dose therapy and for 2 hours after last loading dose

During NIFEdipine loading dose therapy and for 2 hours after last NIFEdipine loading dose: assess maternal BP and heart rate prior to each dose and q15min; assess maternal respiratory rate and O2 sat q1h
Continuous during NIFEdipine loading dose therapy and for 2 hours after last NIFEdipine loading dose
During maintenance therapy for a maximum of 48 hours
During NIFEdipine maintenance dose: maternal BP and heart rate prior to and q4h following each NIFEdipine dose for 48 hours
qshift when Electronic Fetal Monitoring (EFM) is discontinued
Until contractions stop and loading doses of NIFEdipine complete
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
If less than 32 weeks and at risk for imminent birth, consider OB Magnesium Sulfate (Module)
10 mg, PO, q30min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: cap
30 mg, PO, q12h, order duration: 48 hour, drug form: tab-XL
100 mg, rectal, once, drug form: supp, first dose: NOW
25 mg, PO, q6h, order duration: 8 doses or times, drug form: cap
For patients between 23 and 34 weeks of gestation at risk of delivery, administer a single course of corticosteroids
12 mg, IM, q24h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
If additional betamethasone dose(s) to be given as an outpatient encounter, order the OB Betamethasone Outpatient

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
Order if Group B Strep positive (positive culture, Group B Strep bacteriuria in current pregnancy, prior neonate with Group B Strep disease)
If Group B Strep status unknown, order only if risk factors present (less than 37 weeks of gestation, membrane rupture 18 hours or more, fever, prior neonate with Group B Strep disease)
2.5 million_unit, IV, q4h, order duration: 7 day
2,000 mg, IV, once, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated and if organism is susceptible to clindamycin
900 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated and organism susceptibilities unknown
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 7 day
Whole Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Urinalysis Macroscopic (dipstick) with Microscopic if indicated
Urine, Routine, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Urine  (specify site), Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, once
Urine, Midstream, Routine, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once

Consider testing for syphilis if the patient:
- Presents late to prenatal care, or first present at delivery
- Were diagnosed with an STI in the last 10 years
- Are living with a substance use disorder or mental health condition
- Are unstably housed
- Have a history of incarceration
- Engage in sex work or survival sex
- Have a partner who does not live with them, including a partner who lives abroad
- Have an unexplained premature delivery prior to 37 weeks, or pregnancy loss after 20 weeks (including stillbirth)
- You have identified to be at risk
